alert.note: Alert for Pike; Upson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Meriwether, southern Pike and northwestern Upson Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 151 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Greenville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Thomaston, Zebulon, Greenville, Woodbury, Molena, Meansville, Gay, Sunset Village, Lincoln Park, Concord, Atwater, Hilltop, Lifsey Springs, Crest, Sunnyside, Hannahs Mill, Imlac, and Wooster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
